fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30072].
  {panel}

Issue Statistics gadget is sorting issues based on status ids and not by names. This is confusing for the user. Next to this, it does not make much sense to sort by Status ids in the gadget.

Would be nice if we can change this.

Regards,
Ruchi
fields.summary: Issue Statistics gadget - Sort issues alphabetically and not by id

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30071].
  {panel}

The default date on Custom Field Date Time won’t show on the Edit screens and other screens, only on Create Issue screen 

To reproduce this:
# Create an Issue and name it Test1
# Create a custom field of _Date Time_ and name it TestDate1
# Assign TestDate1 in all the screens
# Configure the TestDate1 to have any other date
#* Click on _Edit Default Value_ and set the date to other date eg. 11/Sept/12
#* Leave the box untick and click _Set Default_ button
# Create an Issue and name it Test2, you will able to see the TestDate1 with the date inside (see newissue1.jpg)
# Open Test2 and edit the issue, you will able to see the date inside TestDate1 (see newissue2.jpg)
# Open Test1 and edit the issue, you will *not* able to see the date inside the TestDate1 (see oldissue1.jpg)

It would be nice if the existing issues (Test1) show the default date set for TestDate1 when editing issue and in other screens as well. Any other issue that has empty value for the TestDate1 could also automatically being set to the default date.
fields.summary: Custom field Date Time won’t show the default date on Screen
Issue Collector does not work on Opera Browser
Upgrade Balsamiq to 2.1.19 or later

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30064].
  {panel}

When specifying an issue Original Estimate, we should be able to use decimal point for the estimate value, such as: 
- 1.3d or 3.3 

However, under certain time tracking configuration, inputting 2.3d value into Original Estimate will produce the following error:
- The original estimate specified is not valid
!2.png!

The steps to reproduce:
- Configure the Time Tracking, set the number of working hours per day to 7.5
!1.png!
- Try to create issue and specify 2.3d, and the problem is reproducible

Tested on JIRA 5.0, 5.1.x
fields.summary: Original Estimate do not accept 2.3d value
Bring back the cross-application quick search bar in Atlassian OnDemand
Add some instance size logic to the JIRA OnDemand importer
Typo in jql linkedIssues error message

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30056].
  {panel}

When doing a global quick search, include labels in fields to search.

Steps to reproduce
1. Create an issue
2. Add a label to it such as "ACMEInc"
3. Enter "ACMEInc" in quick search and press Enter

Expected results
Issues that include the label (tag) "ACMEInc" show up in search result

Actual results
Issues that include the label "ACMEInc" do not show up in search results 

I'm basing this off the idea that Labels are the same or similar to "tags" or "keywords".
fields.summary: Include labels field as search criteria in the global search box by default
Issue update emails are garbled for particular issues
Moving issues to new project should move versions and components

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30053].
  {panel}

Currently, there is a guide on this at https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/ATLAS/JIRA+Performance+Testing+with+Grinder

However, this guide is very general and thus insufficient. Add more detail steps so that new users should be able to understand it easily.

A few things that we can improve is:
* should have separate steps to run the test with maven and without maven.
* specify which grinder.properties that need to be modified based on the method used
* in the Grinder.properties file I think we should mention that the exact location of the files need to be specify. (i) example is good
* suggest a clear directory where the jira_users.txt, jira_projects.txt and jira_issues.txt should be created (this is related to point 2)
* suggest in which particular directory user should run the mvn command
* explicitly specify which log can be analyse using the available third party tools (eg: The Grinder Analyzer)
* after converting the log to CSV, provide example on how to utilise the data to generate chart.
fields.summary: Improve the guide on JIRA Performance Test Using Grinder

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30050].
  {panel}

By default, JIRA will list the version(s) of affect version/fix version by the order of version on the Administration side 
!feature.PNG!

From the above image, the bottom version will be listed on the top of the list, and top version will be listed on the bottom of the list.

It would be nice to have a feature, whereby users can select how to list is being displayed, such as viewing the version(s) in ascending order
fields.summary: As a user, I would like the ability to choose how version are listed

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}

Hello,

Can I request a new feature, which is to be able to show the latest comment in the search results. This is useful for generating management and communication reports on projects.

Colin Blackett

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30036].
  {panel}

Customer requests to make the Project > Issues page customisable.
https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Browsing+a+Project's+Issues

Collated customer feedback from the page above:
* Is there a way to modify this page? Can I include count by custom fields? 
* I'm wondering the same Thing, i have defined some custom fields, and would like to have them up on the Project's issues
* Just wondering, how do you sort the status summary for a particular project..?  Do i need a plugin for this scenario..? 
* I really need to change the layout of this page and add a new section, how do I customize this page?
* Looking for an answer to the question that's already been asked: can the Issues Summary be customized?
* Does anyone from Atlassian even read the feedback here? Wondering whether I should bother reasking the question that's already been asked several times. Namely, is it possible to edit the information that is shown on this page?
* Anyone ?? from atlassian ? can you provide any link to help how we can sort versions on issue report screen?
fields.summary: Customise the Project > Issues page
Add a feature to attach files when sharing an issue via email

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30033].
  {panel}

1. Most of our projects use components and versions with the same names.

For example, project A will have components Web, DB, UI.

Project B will also have components Web, DB, UI.

Every time we create a new project, the same components need to be recreated. It will be great if we can have a scheme that will automatically provide a list of components.

2. One screen to edit all schemes for project

This will be great as currently, every project created, we need to go to Issue Types and change the scheme. Then workflow, change the scheme, then field configuration, change the scheme.
A single screen to update all these schemes will be great.
fields.summary: Components and version schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30031].
  {panel}

Inside the Application access of an OnDemand instance we can set how many users are active, thus counting towards to the customer license. However, when creating an user, inside the *Users* screen (clicking on the *'+ Create User'* button, beside the *'Invite Users'*) we can see a message which says:

{quote}
There are currently *X* total user(s) set up in JIRA, of which *Y* are active and count towards your license limit.
{quote}

*However*, this *Y* number ignores if an user has or not *application access* to JIRA. This Y is measured by the condition of the user being part of a group.

Example:

I have a *50* users limit license and *45* users set up in JIRA.

!create_new_user.png!

The message says that: of which *45* are active and count towards your license limit.

However, if a go to my application access, only *41* users has access to JIRA and are *actually* counting towards to the license (41 users active, 3 users inactive and 1 user sysadmin).

!application_access.png!

Which gives me *9 remaining* users. However, when looking at the first screen, it confuses the real number of users which are actually active and counting towards the license.

---

We have two screens showing the same information with different results, how many users are active and counting towards the license. This conflicting information is impacting the user management when they are running out of licenses available.
fields.summary: Active number of users on 'Create User' message mismatch Application Access

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30029].
  {panel}

This might be related to implementation of JRA-27396.

I have an issue that I want to assign. After I click "Assign" button, the popup appears and some user's name is already selected in Assignee field. If I press the down arrow in that field, I see this:

*Suggestions*
Unassigned
Automatic
John Doe
Stuart Smith
Wendy Wang
----------------------
_Start typing for users_
*All Users*
Abe Lincoln
John Kennedy
William McKinley

The *All Users* list is much longer in our case (about 160). Users who are in the suggested list (John Doe, Stuart Smith, Wendy Wang) are missing from *All Users* list.

This is counterproductive as some JIRA users like me never use the suggested list and scroll straight to all users list, but are unable to find the user they are looking for. Please make *All Users* really an all-user list.
fields.summary: Suggested users to be assigned are not in "All Users" list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30027].
  {panel}

We already have the feature to change the Owner of Shared Filters and Dashboards.

However, in changing the owner of the shared filter, one have to go to the owner page > Manage filter > My filter in order to edit the following filter.  If the user has more than 200 filters to manage, this would be a trouble to them.  Another way is to use the Issue Navigator for searching of purpose, which still could be a hassle for some.

A customer requested to have an Improvement to already an awesome feature.  To be able to click on the Shared Filter name (as image below) and be directed to the filter in the Issue Navigator, from there the user could then continue to modify the filter and such.  This would really improve the productivity of the user in managing the shared filters.

This improvement request might also applicable to the Shared Dashboards as well.
fields.summary: Make filter clickable in Shared Filter administration
Method to disable application link functionality
Login gadget should display different details if using External User Management.
The log4j level for com.atlassian.jira.studio package is missing in log4j-studio.properties file

fields.description:
It seems notification about issue activities (create, comment, etc) are not sent to reporter.
Other persons are notified correctly. 
I'm using "Default Notification Scheme" where reporter, all watchers and current assignee are bind to each issue action, so it seems to be ok.

It was working before migration. After installing 5.1.6 above problems are observed.
Configuration of mailbox is the same.
Test mail sent from JIRA works ok.
fields.summary: Notifications are not sent to issue reporter

fields.description:
Our Jira is connected to the external LDAP directory via Crowd. We have no control over LDAP directory contents and from time to time users are removed from the directory (~1 year after they left).

When user is deleted in LDAP, he automatically disappears from Jira. 

The problem occurs when his username was explicitly specified in the list of project developers, users or administrators. Since user is removed from LDAP directory it becomes impossible to remove user name from the list in Project roles configuration page. 

Jira complains that "user doesn't exist" and doesn't allow to change the list.
fields.summary: "user doesn't exist" error when trying to remove user from the project "developers" list

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-30003].
  {panel}

Local directory migration replaces password hash with 'nopass' 

Creating a user directory for migration from internal replaces the password hash in the CREDENTIAL field in cwd_user with 'nopass'.

If you need to revert from LDAP to internal by moving those users back, all passwords must be reset.

To put it mildly, this is a *major* pain.
fields.summary: Support migration from LDAP back to internal user directory

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29997].
  {panel}

Current linking permission in JIRA
When linking an issue with other issue under same JIRA instance, the user is not able to see the link issue  if user does not have permission to view the linking issue,. 

On the other hand, when there are two JIRA instances connected through an application link, a user with non-permission attend to see the link issue and the link issue appear in screen with this message *You do not have the permission to view the issue*. 

It would be great if from same instance, a user with non-permission is able to view the +existent+ of the link issue. The link issue will show up with message *You do not have the permission to view the issue*.

!feature.PNG!
fields.summary: Display issue links even if user has not rights to see the other issue.

fields.description:
Following workflow steps:
Assign / Start Progress / Resolve / Reopen / Start Progress / Stop Progress
The status is changed to "Open" but then receive error:
"Error marking step #183175 finished: root cause: Tried to update an entity that does not exist".  
(the issue appears to be correctly updated and workflow can proceed)
This happens consistently with the steps above, but does not occur for:
Assign / Start Progress / Stop Progress

I see that someone else has the same issue but no answer to date:
https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/80886/errors-on-stopping-progress
fields.summary: Workflow error when "Stop Progress" - Tried to update an entity that does not exist
Add other Atlassian Apps to the JIRA Menu

fields.description:
Can not upgrade plugins using UPM. Why?
Log:
{code}
2012-10-02 19:27:51,793 pool-5-thread-1 ERROR bmk 1167x1023x1 y0dass 10.132.224.58 /rest/plugins/1.0/updates/all [rest.resources.updateall.UpdateAllTask] Failed to download plugin
com.atlassian.upm.RelativeURIException: URI must be absolute
        at com.atlassian.upm.impl.PluginDownloadServiceImpl.checkIfURIIsSupported(PluginDownloadServiceImpl.java:275)
        at com.atlassian.upm.impl.PluginDownloadServiceImpl.downloadPlugin(PluginDownloadServiceImpl.java:85)
        at com.atlassian.upm.rest.resources.updateall.UpdateAllTask.download(UpdateAllTask.java:158)
        at com.atlassian.upm.rest.resources.updateall.UpdateAllTask.call(UpdateAllTask.java:86)
        at com.atlassian.upm.rest.resources.updateall.UpdateAllTask.call(UpdateAllTask.java:46)
        at com.atlassian.upm.rest.async.AsynchronousTaskManager$1.call(AsynchronousTaskManager.java:65)
        at com.atlassian.upm.rest.async.AsynchronousTaskManager$1.call(AsynchronousTaskManager.java:60)
        at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(Unknown Source)
{code}
fields.summary: Can not upgrade plugins

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29961].
  {panel}

This is an important accessibility feature. It is something common for people to copy and paste data to forms and when they are doing this they may add a leading or trailing space by mistake to these fields.

With current implementation this space is preserved and causing problems in numerous situations.

So far, I do no see any use case for not implementing this, even for *all* input forms.

Here are some places where this would be very helpful (:
* Filter Users: User Name Contains, Full Name Contains, Email Contains
* Add Custom Field and Add Custom Field Values.

Note: for "email contains" it would be great to auto-strip non email parts: like "John Doe <john.doe@acme.com>" to become "john.doe@acme.com", or "mailto:john@xx.com" -> ""john@xx.com". It is common to get these formats when you copy/paste and email from different places.
fields.summary: Auto stripping of leading and trailing white spaces from all Jira text input form controls
Summary Field Rendering during Inline Edit
Improve set default button for custom read only text field
Add ability to change keyboard shortcuts

Ruchi

When JIRA makes outbound requests, some configs require that it go through an outbound proxy. It's not working over NTLM.

Note that this is totally unrelated to NTLM authentication for logins.

See https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-2326 for the equivalent confluence issue.

See https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/88723/atlassian-marketplace-server-is-not-reachable.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29905].
  {panel}

Hi Atlassian,

Could you please investigate building into jira the possibility of customizing the options available at the header of each ticket.

Currently the options available are:

* Assign
* Assign to me
* Comment
* More actions

One of options our company's staff users over and over is the "log work" from "More actions".

Could you please implement functionality that would facilitate having that option in the base (top level) header for each ticket.
fields.summary: new feature: move "log work" from "more action" to ticket header
Add a rest call to return the total number of results from a filter
Email address per Jira issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29901].
  {panel}

Here is the procedure to reproduce the issue:

# Set up fresh jira
# Create a user A in the LDAP server which got no membership settings. (single user without group)
# Set up delegated ldap - with only the option "copy User on Login" and set the default group member to "jira-users".
# Login with the user A, so that it can be added in the group "jira-users".
# Logout the user A.
# Edit the delegated user directory and check the option "Synchronise Group Memberships".
# Login with the user A again, we found that it is impossible to login. 

Regarding to the login file, the user had been removed from the user group when login, here is an example of the message: 
{noformat}
2012-09-27 18:39:35,327 http-6512-10 INFO anonymous 1119x482x1 1mknmyc 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [atlassian.crowd.directory.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory] Deleted user "user"'s imported membership of remote group "jira-users" to directory "Delegated Authentication Directory".
2012-09-27 18:39:35,329 http-6512-10 INFO anonymous 1119x482x1 1mknmyc 127.0.0.1 /rest/gadget/1.0/login [atlassian.crowd.directory.DelegatedAuthenticationDirectory] Deleted user "user"'s imported membership of remote group "jira-developers" to directory "Delegated Authentication Directory".
Sep 27, 2012 6:39:35 PM com.sun.jersey.spi.container.servlet.WebComponent filterFormParameters
{noformat}
And we can observe the same in the user list.

So far we have been able to reproduce the bug only with OpenLDAP and Generic Directory Server.

The workaround for now would be to add the group memberships again after checking the "Synchronise Group Memberships" option.
fields.summary: Switching to "Synchronise Group Memberships" option in the delegated user directory should push changes back to remote directory
Be able to define summary value in Issue Collector

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29899].
  {panel}

h3. Problem:
The 'Resolution' field can not retain original value during Bulk Close issue, when performing the bulk transitions from issue navigator. This is only happen when the 'close issue' transition is using the same screen with 'Resolve issue' transition, which screen contains 'Resolution' filed.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Use the same screen for 'close issue'(in Resolved status) and 'Resolve issue' transition, make sure the screen contain 'Resolution' value.
# Search for 3 issue in one project which have different 'Assingee', 'Reporter' and 'Resolution', but same status 'Resolved'. As showing below:
!Capture.JPG|thumbnail!
# Bulk Transition this 3 issues, choose 'close issue', click on next, it will show:
!Capture2.JPG|thumbnail!

Which will force to change the resolution, unlike the 'Change Assignee' can uncheck and keep the same Assignee, even the 3 tickets are having the different 'Assignee'. In this case, if I change the resolution in this step, all the issues will be changed with same Resolution, as shown below:
!Capture3.JPG|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Before doing the bulk edit, remove the *Resolution* field from the Screen. Alternatively, create a draft of the workflow, make the *Close* transition use a different screen, and publish the draft. Only then try to bulk transition the issues.
fields.summary: The 'Resolution' field can not retain original value during Bulk Close issue
Easier way to set schemes

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29892].
  {panel}

When connecting JIRA to a Crowd server, we will auto-synchronise the user and her group memberships if the user was previously unknown.
On the other hand if the user was already known we don't update the group memberships on login, we just wait until next synchronise to update this.

The main reason this is a problem is that the user may have been added to groups "on the fly" during authorisation with the Crowd server.

See JRA-26882 for a discussion.
fields.summary: JIRA should synchronise group memberships for a user on each login
Issue collector can't be closed when placed inside a frameset

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29887].
  {panel}

Configure JIRA's global permissions as such:

JIRA System Administrators = system-administrators
JIRA Administrators = system-administrators
JIRA Users = <EMPTY>
Browse Users = system-administrators
Create Shared Objects = system-administrators
Manage Group Filter Subscriptions = system-administrators
Bulk Change = system-administrators

Reindex JIRA so that it properly sets all permissions.  Now try to create a new dashboard or saved filter.  Now notice that it asks you to log in, even though you are already logged in.  Try again and you'll get challenged again.
fields.summary: Empty 'JIRA Users' global permissions blocks some JIRA operations

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29885].
  {panel}

I'm not sure if inside the "Create Ticket" interface is the best place, but there should be an easier place to have the "Create Component" interface.
Right now its buried in the project administration screens, and its only accessible by certain permission scopes. 

In our context, we have lead developers who take on some of the PM tasks that could involve creating Components, but we don't need them to have full access to everything else a Project Administrator does. 

Thanks!
fields.summary: Allow for the creation of components from inside the 'create ticket' screen.
Add Assign as an Issue Operation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29882].
  {panel}

Hello team,

This is an idea that came on my mind: what if we create a specific log file which tracks the System Information for each restart? It could be a file called {{atlassian-jira-sysinfo.log}}. 
Sometimes you want to retrieve this information, but it's hard to track if you have tons of JIRA logs and need to search for the last restart. This could be also very useful in case of an instance being down and System Information is not available through JIRA UI.

Please let me know if this is possible to implement.
Thanks!
fields.summary: Create JIRA System Information log

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-29878].
  {panel}

There's a new feature with User Directories which has not been updated in the documentation: *Migrate users from one directory to another*

The feature was available for user to move users  from internal directory to *internal directory with LDAP authentication only* and *vice versa* since JIRA 5.0.3

The partial feature(1.1 and 1.2) was introduced in this improvement request: https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24213

I hope it helps.
fields.summary: Update the current User Directories documentation with the new feature
Export of the data shown in the Roadmap gadget to Excel format and add milestone graph to the Roadmap gadget
